alert.note: Alert for Clarke; Frederick; Northern Virginia Blue Ridge; Page; Rockingham; Shenandoah; Warren (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 06 at 11:17AM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Portions of Virginia and eastern West Virginia, including the following areas: in Virginia, Clarke, Frederick VA, Northern Virginia Blue Ridge, Page, Rockingham, Shenandoah and Warren. In eastern West Virginia, Eastern Grant, Eastern Pendleton, Hardy, Western Grant and Western Pendleton. * WHEN...Until 8 PM EDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Slow moving showers and thunderstorms may produce localized rainfall totals of 1 to 3 inches within the watch area, which may lead to instances of flash flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Clarke; Frederick; Northern Virginia Blue Ridge; Page; Rockingham; Shenandoah; Warren
